segments.text: What's the life expectancy in your country ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm not sure , but probably about 75 years . How about in your country ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: About 70 , I think . This newspaper article talks about the problems of an aging population . It's a problem that will soon affect most of the world .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I heard that the government might need to increase the retirement age , because otherwise there will not be enough workers to support the young and the elderly .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Perhaps we need to have more babies ! Tina gave birth to a baby boy yesterday .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Did she ? That's great . However , if we have too many children , that will have a bad effect on the environment .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , he's fine . Kids seem to grow up very quickly nowadays .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: He'll be a teenager before you know it ! Teenagers are often rebellious ! When do you think it is a good age to have a child ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I had mine when I was 24 . That's a little young . I'd suggest you wait until you are in your late twenties , or even in your early thirties if you have a good career .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , I think you're right . I'm thinking about having a child , but not just yet .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Is there a big generation gap between parents and their children in your country ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , there is . Teenagers do not want to live traditional lives . They want to go out , have fun , and explore the world . They want to develop their own view of life.Parents usually try to discour
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Parents usually give their children more freedom in my country . Sometimes they give them too much freedom .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It's almost impossible to get the right balance . If you are too strict , kids might ignore you . If you are too lenient , they might go wild .
segments.speaker: S1
